fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • A headline said “Half of UK’s energy came from clean sources in 2019” (1 January, page 2). The story’s figures were for generation of electricity, rather than energy at large. • We misnamed the party of Taiwan’s president, Tsai Ing-Wen, as the “Democratic People’s party”, when we meant Democratic Progressive party (Taiwan battles pro-China fake news campaign to sway election, 30 December, page 26). • Other recently corrected articles include: Britons paying 40% more for energy than in 2015, analysis reveals Federal judge blocks North Carolina’s voter ID law, citing its discriminatory intent Aotearoa is at last finding its voice, helping us heal after a year of tragedy Planting trees is only a good news story if it’s done right Asia’s hardest year for dengue fever – in pictures
